meanings.definition: Moving or tending to move away from a center.
meanings.sent1: The centrifugal force pushed the toy car outward from the center.
meanings.sent2: The centrifugal motion of the spinning top caused it to move away from the middle.
meanings.sent3: The centrifugal swing flung the child outwards with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like a centrifugal force, always pulling her away from the norm.
meanings.sent5: The centrifugal effect of the tornado scattered debris in all directions.

meanings.definition: Operated by means of centrifugal force.
meanings.sent1: The centrifugal pump used the force to move water outwards.
meanings.sent2: The centrifugal dryer spun the clothes rapidly to remove excess water.
meanings.sent3: The centrifugal blender whirred loudly as it mixed the ingredients.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a centrifugal machine, constantly processing information.
meanings.sent5: The centrifugal mechanism in the engine helped regulate the speed of the vehicle.

meanings.sent1: The centrifugal energy of the fireworks made them explode outwards.
meanings.sent2: The centrifugal motion of the dancer's twirls captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The centrifugal cat chased its tail in circles around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was like a centrifugal magnet, drawing people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The centrifugal design of the building allowed for maximum airflow.
